revised_title: Experimental Methods for Measuring Bond Dissociation Energies and Heats of Formation of Radicals
tldr: The author discusses various methods for measuring bond dissociation energies and heats of formation of radicals, focusing on the pyrolytic method using toluene as a carrier gas. The author explains the challenges and advantages of this method and provides examples of its application to various chemical reactions.
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Chemical Bonding and Molecular Geometry
